narrative.title: 4Th Infantry Division - 1943Q2
narrative.situation: British infantry_division_mixed deployed in North Africa during 1943Q2.
narrative.objectives: British First Army mixed division (2 infantry brigades + 1 tank brigade) executing Tunisia campaign final offensive (Operations Vulcan and Strike, April-May 1943). Division fought under V Corps initially, then transferred to IX Corps for final offensive. Engaged elite German paratroopers (Hermann GÃ¶ring Division) in costly fighting. Division fresh from UK, not desert-experienced like 8th Army formations. Specialized in combined infantry-tank operations using Churchill infantry tanks.
narrative.axis_objective: Hold current positions and prevent Allied breakthrough.
narrative.allied_objective: Advance and neutralize Axis defensive positions.

weather.terrain: Northern Tunisia: Medjerda Valley (relatively flat river valley with agricultural land), hilly terrain with defensive positions, restricted terrain channeling movement. Cactus Farm area: well-concealed defensive positions for German paratroopers. Valley approaches to Tunis.

special_rules: Mixed division structure unique - integrated tank brigade (21st Army Tank Bde)
Combined arms operations with Churchill infantry tanks organic to division
Churchill tanks provided close infantry support - heavily armored but slow
Fresh division from UK with full strength and modern equipment
Two Regular Army infantry brigades with professional training
Strong artillery support - demonstrated by 16,000 shell bombardment May 5-6
